page.title: 14FOOTPATHS
page.content: There are numerous{footpaths}in the area but they tend to be rather fragmented and would have originally have been used for short cuts. The {countryside}they pass through is flat, a mixture of natural woodland, rough grazing and arable farmland. Fields are large with clear evidence of the mass destruction of{hedgerows.}Many footpaths tend to be overgrown and difficult to follow. Several instances were found where the path had been planted over. Most people care about the paths but only walk them occasionally, for recreation. The giant{tele-communications mast}at Kelvedon Hatch dominates the area and is a clearly visible landmark for miles around.
